page.title: 21Ockbrook 2011
page.content: In recent years, the village has under gone may changes. The building of a brand new housing estate in the centre of the village helped to bring in new blood and has drawn in more young parent families. Several new houses have been built around the village and the population ha shifted from farmers and rural folk to fairly well-off professionals looking for a quiet place to live just outside of Nottingham and Derby. There is still very little to do in the village apart from the four pubs: the White Swan, The Royal Oak, The Cross Keys and The Queen's Head. A conservative parish council have been in charge for several years now, most recently winning the parish elections in May 2011.
